intro: Peucedanum abyssinicum, commonly known as Abyssinian angelica, is a herbaceous plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its roots are often harvested for their aromatic properties and traditional medicinal uses. Peucedanum abyssinicum thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to high-altitude ecosystems.
